trans-unit.source: Why we require an enterprise administrator account
trans-unit.target: Why we require an enterprise administrator account

trans-unit.source: Why we require an enterprise administrator account for connecting to AD DS when setting up Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Why we require an enterprise administrator account for connecting to AD DS when setting up Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the reasons an enterprise administrator account is required for setting up Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the reasons an enterprise administrator account is required for setting up Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: For Express Settings and DirSync Upgrade
trans-unit.target: For Express Settings and DirSync Upgrade

trans-unit.source: For Express Settings, we create the local Active Directory account that is used for sync (otherwise known as the AD Connector account) and assign the correct permissions for sync and password sync
trans-unit.target: For Express Settings, we create the local Active Directory account that is used for sync (otherwise known as the AD Connector account) and assign the correct permissions for sync and password sync

trans-unit.source: For Dirsync upgrade, we reset the password on the currently configured AD Connector account and configure the new Azure AD Connect sync service to use this account.
trans-unit.target: For Dirsync upgrade, we reset the password on the currently configured AD Connector account and configure the new Azure AD Connect sync service to use this account.

trans-unit.source: More on Azure AD Connect accounts and permissions
trans-unit.target: More on Azure AD Connect accounts and permissions

trans-unit.target: Custom installation of Azure AD Connect
